{{quote|But always I have let my horn cry at setting forth, and though thereafter we may walk in the shadows, I will not go forth as a thief in the night.|[[Boromir]] in ''[[The Fellowship of the Ring]]'', "[[The Ring Goes South]]"}}
The '''Great Horn''' was an heirloom of the [[House of Húrin]] until its destruction on [[26 February]] {{TA|3019}}.

The horn was made from the wild white [[Kine of Araw]] of [[Rhûn]],<ref>{{App|A1ii}}</ref> which was likened to an ''[[wikipedia:Aurochs|aurochs]]''.<ref>{{HM|RC}}, p. 265</ref> It was white itself, tipped with silver and inscribed with ancient characters.<ref name="Window"/> It was said in legend that if the Horn was blown anywhere within the bounds of ancient Gondor, its call would not pass unheeded.<ref name="Window"/>

It is generally referred to simply as "the horn of Boromir"<ref name="Window">{{TT|Window}}</ref><ref name="Departure"/> as he was its most known (and last) bearer.

==History==
The Great Horn was made from the horn of a [[Cows|wild-ox]] of [[Rhûn]]. [[Vorondil the Hunter]], the father of [[Mardil|Mardil Voronwë]], hunted the beasts in the far fields of the East. So, after Mardil Voronwë it passed down to every eldest son.<ref name="MT">{{RK|MT}}</ref> From [[Denethor]], it passed down to Boromir, who wore it with him on a baldric.<ref name="Council">{{FR|Council}}</ref>

Boromir bore the horn with him when he went to [[Rivendell|Imladris]], and held it on his lap during the [[Council of Elrond]].<ref name="Council"/> After he was chosen to be one of the [[Fellowship of the Ring|Fellowship]], he let the horn ring through Rivendell.<ref name="South">{{FR|South}}</ref> He would wind the horn twice more. In reply to the meager horns of the [[Orcs]] in [[Moria]], the Great Horn bellowed like the shout of many throats under the cavernous roof. Though it repelled the attackers for a while, they returned after the last echo disappeared.<ref>{{FR|Bridge}}</ref> 
[[File:Ted Nasmith - Boromir's Last Stand.jpg|200px|right|thumb|''Boromir's Last Stand'' by [[Ted Nasmith]]]]
The last time the horn was rung was shortly before its destruction, on [[26 February|February 26]], on the slopes of [[Amon Hen]], near [[Parth Galen]]. While fighting, Boromir created a sound so loud that it could be heard in [[Minas Tirith]].<ref name="MT"/> Sadly, the little help that could come - the rest of the Fellowship - could not make it in time. Though the Uruk-hai were at first dismayed and drew back, they returned more fierce than ever.<ref>{{TT|Uruk}}</ref> In the fight that cost Boromir's life, the horn was cloven in two. 

[[Aragorn]], [[Gimli]] and [[Legolas]] laid it in the elven boat with Boromir and his weapons and sent it down the falls of [[Rauros]].<ref name="Departure">{{TT|Departure}}</ref> The two parts of the horn fell out of the boat, and were found several days later. One was found in the reeds near the mouths of [[Entwash]] on [[28 February|February 28]], the other further down the river on [[30 February|February 30]].<ref>{{HM|Scheme}}, p. 469</ref> They were brought to Denethor, who held them on his lap, anxiously waiting for news of his beloved son.<ref name="Window"/> Those answers came, eventually, when [[Gandalf]] brought [[Peregrin Took]], witness to Boromir's last stand, before the Steward.<ref name="MT"/>

==Inspiration==
Both [[wikipedia:Roland|Roland]], the paladin of Charlemagne, and Boromir bore a white horn.<ref>[[Gerard Seaman]], "Old French Literature", published in ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien Encyclopedia]]'' (edited by [[Michael Drout]]), p. 468-9</ref> Like Roland in battle with the Saracens blew his horn to call for Charlemagne, Boromir called for Aragorn. In both cases, help came too late.<ref>{{HM|RC}}, p. 359</ref>

'''1978: [[The Lord of the Rings (1978 film)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (1978 film)]]:'''
:Boromir blows the horn after he has been hit by many arrows. Boromir's signal has two tones, the second higher than the first (it's the same sound heard by other horns, Rohirrim or Hobbits'). It survived the battle without being broken.<ref>''[[The Lord of the Rings (1978 film)|J.R.R. Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings]]'', "[[Borimir's Sacrifice]]"</ref>

'''1981: [[The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (1981 radio series)]]:'''
:Boromir winds the horn in Rivendell, where it produces a clear sound of five notes.<ref>[[The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (1981 radio series)]], "The Council Of Elrond"</ref> At the advice of [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]], he blows it again at Amon Hen,<ref>[[The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (1981 radio series)]], "The Mirror of Galadriel"</ref> which is heard by the others.<ref>[[The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (1981 radio series)]], "The Breaking of the Fellowship"</ref>

'''2001: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring]]'':'''
:The Horn is a white horn. Boromir blows it at Amon Hen, three short blows twice. When [[Lurtz]] shoots arrows at Boromir, the horn appears broken when the third arrow hits him.<ref name="Breaking">[[The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (extended edition)|''The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring'' (extended edition)]], "[[The Breaking of the Fellowship (scene)|The Breaking of the Fellowship]]"</ref>

'''2002: [[The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (video game)|''The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring'' (video game)]]:'''
:Though Boromir does wear the horn, he does not use it.

'''2002: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers]]'':'''
:After telling Frodo and Sam of how he found a boat with Boromir's body on the Anduin,<ref>[[The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers (extended edition)|''The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers'' (extended edition)]], "[[The Window on the West (scene)|The Window of the West]]"</ref> Faramir holds the two pieces in his hands.<ref>[[The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers (extended edition)|''The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers'' (extended edition)]], "[[Sons of the Steward]]"</ref>
'''2003: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King]]'':'''
:Denethor regained possession of the Horn, and showed it to [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]].<ref>[[The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers (extended edition)|''The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers'' (extended edition)]], "[[Minas Tirith (scene)|Minas Tirith]]"</ref> 

'''2006: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Battle for Middle-earth]]'':'''
:The Horn of Gondor is one of Boromir's powers. It weakens nearby enemy units.<ref name="bfme">''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Battle for Middle-earth]]'', "Manual"</ref>

'''2012: ''[[Lego The Lord of the Rings: The Video Game]]'':'''
:The Horn of Gondor is among Boromir's accessories. When blown, it briefly incapacitates enemies, and can also be wielded as a melee weapon. Boromir's ghost also blows it to announce his presence at the [[Grey Havens]] as the Fellowship arrives to bid farewell to Frodo.
